body:
# Bug Report

## Description

The app is crashing after sending an edited message where a link preview was removed.
It seems the crash happens in `status-go`
NOTE: The receiver will also crash when receiving the edited message
<!-- Provide a short description describing the problem you are experiencing. -->

## Steps to reproduce
1. Send a message containing one link preview
2. Go to message history and click edit on the previously sent message
3. Replace the url with any text
4. Hit Enter to send the message
<!-- example: step 1. do X step 2. do Y etc.. -->

#### Expected behavior
Message is edited and sent, no crash
#### Actual behavior
Message is edited and sent, app crashes
### Additional Information

- Status desktop version: Tested on 0.14RC12 and master https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/commit/2d4e20585
- Operating System: MacOS

Hi there,
Currently I am just trying to reproduce, as I didn't get any chance on Linux with Ubuntu 22.04.3 LTS yet 

Edit 1 :
I do have a MacBook pro 2017, I'll try to reproduce the problem there to see if the platform plays a role as the submitter of the problem tested on MacOs

Edit 2 :
After testing with MacOs, I also couldn't reproduce the issue. To assess that I am seeing the problem I'll try to reproduce the problem on 0.14RC12. Then I'll come back to reproducing the same steps on the recent versions of the app

Edit 3 : 
After confirming that the platform doesn't play a specific role in reproducing the issue, I am back on Linux to continue testing.
I managed to reproduce the issue with the following setup : 

```
$ git branch

* (HEAD detached at b5723db3c)
  master
```

Then I compiled the application as usual

```
$ make run
```

Once the application launched, I followed the same steps provided in the issue submitter description. by sending a message that contains a link preview, then I edited the message changing the text to `test`. As a result, the application **crashed** as stated in the ticket. I could reproduce the issue consistently
